abstract.p: Sandy Barbo letter comments on July 27 article on high-capacity flushing toilets

block.p: Re ''The Conservative Agenda: A Big Flush'' (July 27):
Re ''The Conservative Agenda: A Big Flush'' (July 27):

Apparently, we Americans have become so dependent on corporate America to define our consumer options, and on the notion that bigger is better, that we are tripping over each other to get across the Canadian border to buy the high-capacity flushing toilets whose sale is banned in our own country. What most plumbers, plumbing outlets, new home builders and certainly the manufacturers won't tell you is that there are low-capacity toilets manufactured abroad, like Toto, a toilet from Japan (www.totousa.com), which work well, are easy to install and are inexpensive. Shame on the major American manufacturers for bullying the industry and consumers to keep this innovation a secret. What's the big deal? Why can't American manufacturers develop their own low-flushers that work? Meanwhile, having tested Toto's basic model, I'm replacing the rest of the erratically functioning toilets in my brand new home. This is not a story about government interference, this is a story about corporate laziness.
